inn1.comm: and Tharanga has nonchalantly leant into the first ball and driven it past extra cover. Not much power, just met it, and superb placement
Dilshan has no time for niceties, he stands tall and absolutely smashes this past extra cover. Top start
pulls the length back a bit, also gets some seam in, beats Dilshan but it is heading down the leg side
misses out, nice juicy length ball on the pads, but the late movement finds the pad instead of the bat
Dilshan on fire, lovely wrists, just back of a length, not much room, but he squeezes it past point, the whole power comes from the wrists in this shot
slower ball, makes room and cuts it, gets a single to third man
poor bowling, with fine leg up, he bowls a nice juicy long hop on the pads, Dilshan does the rest
on the pads again, worked square of short fine leg for two
slower ball, Dilshan plays away from the body, but it goes safely to third man along the ground
hint of swing away from Tharanga who respectfully defends it towards mid-off
looks to run this down to third man but it is too close to him, and he gets an underside edge onto his boot
charges at him but is not quite there to the pitch of the ball and plays a defensive stroke
slower ball, 128.2ks, but too full, a nice half-volley and he murders it through the covers. Sanga, in the balcony, applauds. "Shot," he says
shot again! whipped away from outside off, wide of mid-on, gets a couple
Dilshan you beauty! Short ball, into the body, and just like that he pulls it for six over square leg. Also hits on the half-volley that boundary board that gets him US$ 1500. Superb placement I say
slower ball, makes room and guides it to third man
looks to cut, it's too close to him, the bottom edge goes fine of keeper who gets one hand to it
nice drive on the up, would have been four but for the full-length dive from extra cover
double-barrel attack! Full delivery, and elegantly driven through a crowded cover field, between extra cover and mid-off
underside edge again, third time for Tharanga today, and again he manages a single
defended to cover, was the slower ball so he checks the shot
slower ball again, guides it past cover for one
slower ball again, played straight to point
full, nearly a yorker, gets in inside edge onto the pad
full and straight again, Dilshan can't squeeze it past cover
and lovely shot again, similar delivery again and Dilshan doesn't want to hit to a fielder, opens the face and adjusts the shot accordingly to get it between extra cover and short cover
bouncer, too short, too high
whoa! Dilshan is looking unstoppable. Not much wrong with this delivery, back of a length, around off, but Dilshan clears the front leg and punches it past cover-point
looking to go in front of square he charges at him, Shafiul bowls wide of off and beats him
and he retains the strike too, with a single to short third man
too easy, at least Dilshan makes it look too easy. Full and flat delivery, and he drives it with an open face, past cover
angling in, cramping Dilshan for room, extracting a rare defensive stroke
and again, he just pats a flighted delivery back to the bowler
works this one with the angle, past short fine leg, soft hands mean he has enough time to come back for two
poor bowling, full, on the pads, with short fine leg in, and he sweeps it past that man for another boundary
flat outside off, defended to point
back of a length, around off, defended
shortish, no room, can't get it past point
the rare play and miss, the second of the innings, pokes at it outside off, and it seams away to beat the bat
solidly defended, four dot balls in a row. Stop the press
manufactures a shot, moves inside the line, and short-arm-pulls a length delivery over square leg
another defensive shot, around off, and played to cover
stays low but Dilshan adjusts well to keep it out
angled into the pads, pushed to midwicket
superb fifty, comes with a nurdle to short fine leg
flighted around off, presses forward and defends
straighter, played to short midwicket with soft hands
enough of cute defending, Tharanga shimmies down the track and lofts him straight over his head. Lovely exhibition of batting here
powerful shot, straight towards extra cover who somehow gets his body behind it
it only gets better here! half-volley on the pads, and he on-drives it between the bowler and mid-on. And doesn't even move, just admires his shot
cut to deep point for one
bottom edge again as he looks to run it down to third man
guides it past point for a single
nearly a yorker across his body, still manages a crunchy hit that surprises extra cover but he does well to not let it go through
and he bowls wide outside off with a strong leg-side field, lovely back-cut, between point and short third man
straighter this time, no room at all, defended back to Rasel
looks to create room and cuts it from in front of off stump, can't get it past point
slower ball on middle and leg, defended to midwicket
worked away off the pads this time, gets a single to square leg
slower ball, on the pads, gets a single to deep square leg
straying onto the pads, clipped away for one
flighted around off, pushed back to the bowler
another flighted delivery, gets single down the ground
drives inside-out, gets a single to sweeper-cover
pushed down the ground for one
superb shot, back-cut, waits for it, makes room, and guides it past short third man
drives away from the body, gets a thick edge to third man for one
short and wide, cut away, thanks for coming
back of a length, pushed down the ground for one
back of a length, pushed to extra cover
on the pads, can't get it past midwicket
shot! Deft touch. No room here but he opens the face at the last moment, and gets it past the keeper, very fine
worked away for one to square leg
looks to run this down too, can't get it past short third
driven to long-off for another single
comes down the track and pushes it down to long-on for one
again a single down the ground
looks for a single to long-on, but ends up playing it towards midwicket
single taken down the ground
looks to sweep, too slow, and he slips while trying to play the shot
played with an open face, can't get it past extra cover
flighted around off, played back to the bowler
makes room to hit this down to long-on for one
goes back to try and work this to on side but finds midwicket
looks for the late cut but it is too full for it and he can't place it wide enough of short third
tries the same shot, to same effect
gets a single into the on side, just working it around now
presses forward to pat a flighted delivery back to the bowler
defended with an open face, towards point this time
flicked away towards deep midwicket, thinks of two but takes only one
makes room, cuts this from in front of stumps, wide of deep point, runs hard to come back for two
flighted around the pads, defended to midwicket
driven inside-out, but can't get it past extra cover
full, gets a single to deep point
Dilshan is gone! Leading edge as he looks to work this back-of-a-length delivery into the on side. Simple return catch for Shakib, tame way to end a superb innings
flighted delivery, looks for a single to long-on, hits towards midckwet
big wide down the leg side
back of a length, around off, played with an open face, can't beat point
almost another leading edge as he looks to work this into the on side, this one, though, dies there only
length ball, around off, defended
shorter, around off, pushed back to the bowler
on the pads, can't get into a gap on the leg side, ends up playing it back to the bowler
finds mid-on this time, only the wide from this over
back of a length, off-stump line, Sanga gets nicely behind it and defends
into the pads, played towards midwicket
square-drives this one, but finds point
into the pads, worked away for one
too full, driven back, Rasel gets a hand to it, saves four runs
gets a single to wide of mid-on
Mahmudullah makes a diving save at point, and for good measure shies at the non-striker's end to send Sanga back in
runs it off the face to third man for a single
shuffles across a bit to get inside the line and work this to deep square leg
misses out, this was down the leg side with the fine leg up, but he gets only a leg-bye
nicely driven on the up, but again finds a fielder, mid-off this time
another good-looking shot finds a fielder, a flick to midwicket this time
back of a length, around off, helped into the off side for one
slipped off the pads, wide of square leg, comes back for two
another clip off the pads, this time to the other side of square leg, gets another two
on the up, but straight to mid-on

nice delivery, can't say that for too many deliveries from Bangladesh today. And even this one goes for four. lovely legcutter, moving away from Sanga, gets a thick edge that flies between point and short third man
on the pads, flicked away for a single
sneaks in a quick single to mid-off
runs this down to third man, from in front of off almost
moves half forward and defends to extra cover
pulled away nicely, gets only a single to deep square leg
full, driven, straight to mid-off
driven inside-out for a single
into the pads, looks for a single down the ground, but straight midwicket does well here
short and wide and he is quick to rock back and play the back-cut, between point and short third. Top shot
cut in front of square this time, gets just a single
wide down the leg side
full on the pads, worked away for an easy single
nicely played, into the pads again, delays the clip suitably to get it fine of fine leg for a couple of runs
flighted around off, pushed back to the bowler
looks for a sharp single but is rightly sent back as it has gone straight to midwicket
into the pads, defended towards midwicket
flighted delivery around off, another defensive shot
nicely driven inside-out, gets a single
hit back down the ground, Mahmud dives to his right to field
clipped off the pads for one
pushed down to long-on for a single
flicked away off the pads, between deep square and fine leg, comes back for two
placed past cover for a single
cut away, gets another single
flighted around off, watchfully defended
inside edge onto the pad as he plays for the turn but this goes straight on
connects well this time, but finds extra cover
looks for the back-cut, but it is too full and too close for that shot, and is duly beaten
full on the pads, easy single taken to long-on
dances down the track and pushes it down to long-on, another single
pushed back to the bowler, who makes a diving save to his right
another single to sweeper-cover
and again
into the pads, clipped away fine, gets two
flighted around off, played with an open face towards point
tossed up generously, driven straight to extra cover
finds the gap with this one, gets a single to sweeper-cover again
drops and runs, gets a single to cover

More to cheer for Bangladeshi supporters as Tharanga is stumped. This is angling down the leg side, and he looks to play it fine of fine leg and makes too fine a contact and Mushfiqur is quick to get down the leg side and take the catch. Instinctively he takes a step down the wicket, and Mushfiqur is quick with the stumping, just in case. I remember them taking at least one couple each over with this shot, and here it has got his wicket
wide down the leg side
defended back to the bowler
full ball, driven to wide long-on for one
back of a length, pushed to extra cover
length ball, played back to the bowler
played back to the bowler again
shortish and widish, cut away, can't get it wide enough of point, only a single
flighted on the pads, played to midwicket
chips down the track but finds the same fielder
goes long-off this time, and gets a single
run-out missed! played straight to cover and Sanga initiates the single and then sends Mahela back. Ashraful's throw misses
short and wide, cut away wide of sweeper-cover
short and wide again, placed even better this time, will get four between the two deep fielders on the off side
angling into the pads, fails to make contact, the ball rolls off the pad
watchfully played back to the bowler
misses another delivery on the pads
short, into the body, Mahela leans back and pulls it past midwicket
cut away off a length, gets a single to point
goes for the wild slog sweep from outside off, misses altogether
looks to pull, finds square leg in the circle
comes down the track, gets a single to long-on
driven inside-out, gets a single to sweeper-cover
nicely played, waits for a flighted delivery outside off, lets it spin, then opens the face, past keeper and short third
lapped away fine, gets two more
turning into the pads, played to midwicket
looks for the back-cut, too full for the shot, is beaten
pushed down to long-on for one
way down the leg side, doesn't get bat on it but gets two leg-byes. Ridiculous appeal from the bowler. This would have missed another set of stumps
into the pads, worked away into the leg side for one
short delivery, played straight to midwicket
chips down the track, flicks it from leg-stump line for one
looks for the late-cut again, beaten, and Mushfiqur doesn't collect cleanly
defended outside off
into the pads, gets an easy single
defended into the on side
connects with the late-cut, gets a couple
finds short third man with the late-cut this time
lap sweep, over short fine leg, gets inside the line so that he can go over the on side
into the pads, worked away for one
into the pads again, worked away for a single
short and wide, cut away, straight to point
gets a single to sweeper-cover
turning into the pads, worked away for one
driven inside-out for one
sharp turn there as Mahela looks for the late-cut, ends up dropping his wrists to keep it down
driven inside-out
pushed to extra cover
presses right forward to defend the flighted delivery
played with an open face to point
another dot, playing straight to extra cover
converts this into a low full toss by chipping down the track and takes a single to long-on
looks for the lap sweep, but misses, is hit on the toe outside the line of off
starts off with a nice full toss wide outside off and Sanga collects four for it, square of the deep cover
low full toss again, gets a single to long-off
wide down the leg side, and again this one pitches way after the stump - three misdirected full tosses so far
gets the yorker right this time, they still steal the single
another full toss wide outside off, but this time deep cover comes around to field
low full toss, worked away to deep square leg for one
another low full toss, Sanga misses out on this one
slower ball, low full toss, Mahela pushes it back, Rasel dives to his left to field
top shot, makes room, gets another full toss and drives it between cover and extra cover
even better! Makes room, goes inside-out, gets under the length ball, and over extra cover. Beautiful
drops this towards cover for one
driven to long-on for one
late-cuts this one, but can't get it past short third man
what a beautiful shot, another inside-out drive, all along the ground, between cover and extra cover. Lovely

gone! Goes for another inside-out shot, but he has followed him and cramped him, hence a weak shot to cover-point. While walking back, Mahela gestures to Sanga that he should have gone over midwicket with this one
defends the first ball he faces, length ball on the off stump
yorker outside off, hit back to the bowler
short and wide, flayed away wide of deep cover for two
into the pads, full, flicked away, gets a single to midwicket
follows him as he looks to make room, gets a single into the on side
full, around off, gets a single to extra cover
shot! Makes room, gets a length ball, and muscles it back past the bowler. Billy Bowden does well to get out of the way
misses out, makes room, Mashrafe follows him with a juicy full toss on the pads, but he flicks it straight to short fine leg
follows him again, gets it to pitch this time, concedes a single to deep square leg
full toss, driven to mid-off for one
wide full toss, Sanga gets to his fifty with a four to point
full ball, driven nicely, but straight to extra cover
truth is stranger than fiction, that wide full toss gets Bangladesh a wicket! Sangakkara reaches out for it, and makes a weak contact, and finds cover-point
slower ball outside off, he leaves it alone
another slower ball, played softly towards deep midwicket, gets two
wide down the leg side, full toss again
looks to play into the leg side, gets a leading edge towards extra cover, along the ground
slower ball, gets a single to extra cover
back of a length, played straight to midwicket, sends Mathews back
worked away into the on side for one
slower ball, around off, played back to the bowler
another slower ball, played to point
slower ball again, and hit straight to a cover fielder again
comes down the track, pushes it into the on side for one
inside edge as he looks to defend this outside off
full ball, pushed down to long-on for one
driven inside-out for a single
looks to work into the on side, is hit on the pad
full ball, worked into the on side for one
slower ball, defended back to the bowler
another slower ball, worked past midwicket for two
slower ball again, guided past point for one
he is only bowling slower balls, another single to square leg
and again, and another single to cover
and he continues with his slower deliveries, driven to long-on for one
pushed to cover for one
wide down the leg side
looks to drop and run, Mushfiq is quick to prevent them from doing so
looks to play square, can't beat point
quicker ball, nearly a yorker, played back to the bowler
full ball, whipped wide of long-on for two
full toss, and again they take two wide of long-on
short, quicker one for a change, pulled away for one - hits the toe of the bat and the thing is broken down the middle
back to slower ones, flicked away to square leg
full ball, hit to midwicket
charges down the track, yorks himself, gets a single to long-off
another slower ball, drags it from outside off to long-on
quicker one, length ball, hit over extra cover, lovely timing, gets six
back of a length, pushed to deep midwicket for one
pushed down to long-on for another single
full toss outside off, driven to long-off for one
driven to long-on for one
flighted outside off, defended to cover
worked away to short fine for one
comes down the track and pulls the slower one for one
worked away to short fine for a single
gets an inside edge on the slower one, fine of keeper for one
slower ball again, single again
long hop, pulled for one
slower ball again, sick of these slower ball,s played straight to point
looks for an inside-out hit and plays way inside the line
another offcutter, worked off the pads for one
wide down the leg side
finally something here, length ball, waited for it, and lofted it over long-on
takes a single to short third man
another single to long-off
looks to loft it, mis-hits to wide of long-on for two
too many slower balls, the batsmen are just waiting for them now, and Kapu this time goes over long-off, clean connection and gets six
into the pads, worked away for another single to bring up 300 at this ground for the first time
yorker outside off, played back to the bowler
length ball, drilled to long-off, they hustle through for two
yorker, dug out to long-off for one
full delivery, worked wide of long-on, they come back for two
full again, hit to long-on for one
poor delivery, gentle one on the pads with fine leg up, can't get more generous to batsmen
looks to go over long-off, beaten
full, driven to long-off for one
worked into the on side for one - length ball it was

inn2.comm: and Tamim starts superbly, Kula pitches up a gentle inswinger, and he has driven it straight down the ground for four. Lovely shot
and again, slightly shorter, and he goes over mid-off, not the meatiest of connections but enough to clear mid-off
another four, he is painting the ground anti-clockwise - first straight, then over mid-off, then over cover, lovely batting
Tamim misses, goes for a six perhaps this time, but ends up swinging inside the line
edged, swing there for Kula and Tamim plays a defensive shot, the edge falls short of first slip
Kayes takes a single wide of mid-in for one to get off the mark
thick outside edge straight away, goes along the ground, past slip for one
yorker outside off, the outside half of the bat takes it past slip
full, just outside off, defended to cover
back of a length, guided away to third man
looks to play into the leg side, gets a leading edge square into the off side
bouncer, and he is not prepared for it, and is hit in the shoulder as he looks to get out of the way
wide, way wide of off, he chases it and fails to make contact
beaten outside off, just hangs his bat there and it swings past him
and again, lovely inswinger, goes past his hanging bat
straighter to start off with, making him play, he defends it back to the bowler
does he have a rod or a bat? gone fishing outside off too often, and beaten again
and finally he has himself been netted! Finally that inevitable edge comes as he hangs his bat away from the body, and Mahela takes a neat low catch at second slip
leaves one outside off
slower ball, gets a single past point
yorker, lovely yorker, quick too, digs it out past slip
Tamim! Lovely shot, short delivery, leans back a touch to make room, and also gets on his toes to hit it over point, and he does that
bouncer, and this time Tamim gets under it
another short one, rising towards his chest, right on the toes, defends it, keeps it down
slower ball, worked past mid-on for one
plays for the swing, gets an inside edge towards square leg
short and wide, punched away in front of square, through the gap, lovely shot
straighter, no room here, makes him play back to the bowler
another lovely shot, width again, this time goes over the infield, and clears them with ease
what a lovely drive, on the up, back down the ground, Kula gets a hand to it and saves two runs
angling in, crunchily played back to the bowler
goes back to face this length delivery, just wide of mid-on, but they take a single
slower ball, yorker, on the pads, he is fooled into lobbing this in the air, but it clears square leg in the circle
another slower ball, checks the shot, in the air for a bit, bout bounces short of mid-on, they take a single
digs this one in short, Tamim looks for the pull, is early into the shot, and is hit in the thigh
length ball, fast and straight, played back to the bowler
slower ball, nearly a yorker, played back with soft hands
swing again, Junaid drives outside off and is beaten
gets behind this one, punches it away, but straight to cover
another solid punch, finds extra cover again
shorter, hit towards extra cover again
effective shot, length ball outside off, and he plays with the open face and deliberately over the covers
goes over the on side this time, length ball again, on the pads, and he flicks it over square leg. Very good start for Bangladesh
lovely slower yorker, dipping fast, straight, Tamim just about manages to get some bat on it
full and quick, played with an open face towards third man
Junaid is playing a blinder here, picks the slower ball early, gets the length to get under and clips it off the pads, deliberately in the air, over midwicket
yorker outside off, digs it out
lovely off-drive, half-volley outside off, and he meets it with a full face, and hits it between the bowler and mid-off, all along the ground

bouncer, nasty one, catches the elbow guard as he looks to duck, and it lobs up and Kapugedara runs in from point, dives in full length, takes the catch, only to be told by the umpire there is no bat involved
on target, skidding, no turn, defended in front of off and middle
goes for the big slog sweep, and there is no spin again, and he ends up swinging outside its line
and another attempt at slog sweep, inside-edges onto his pad
into the pads, looks to work it fine, misses, is hit on the pad
full, nearly yorker, fast, played back to Dilshan
tossed up on the pads, pushed down to long-on for one
flighted around leg, turning towards off, defended
flighted around off, hit powerfully, but to cover
goes for another big hit, gets a single to wide of mid-off
tossed up around off, pushed t0 mid-off
swatted across the line, the mis-hit goes wide of mid-on
topspinner, stays back in the crease and defends
again playing for the spin and gets an inside edge
overpitched, pushed down to long-on for one
short, looks to cut, no room, played to cover
pushed to long-off for another single
shortish, straight, hit back to the bowler
lovely dive to his right by Dilshan to prevent the single to long-off
worked off the pads for a single
flicked off the pads, but straight to short fine leg
shorter, turning towards off, punched away to extra cover
loopy delivery, doosra, doesn't turn much, but enough to take inside edge as he looks to cover-drive
flat and on the pads, worked away into the on-side gap for two
flat on the pads again, gets a single to deep midwicket
leading edge as he looks to push it to long-on, and it flies wide of Dilshan to long-off
square-drive on the up, Murali makes a diving save at cover
driven inside-out, gets a single
flighted on middle and leg, pushed to long-on for one
goes back and punches a flat delivery wide of long-off to come back for two
into the pads, looks to work it for one, but is hit in the pad, a bit early into the shot
nice offbreak, pitches leg, turns towards off, played back to the bowler
lovely shot, reverse-swept from outside leg stump, between cover-point and point

and it works immediately! Kula you beauty, what a lovely catch! Junaid sweeps, gets a top edge towards deep square leg, Kula runs in from fine leg, makes lovely ground, and then dives to get his fingers under it before it can hit the grass
pushed to long-off for a single
turning into the pads, defended towards midwicket
looks to work it off the pads, Dilshan flies across with a dive from square leg, a single saved
flighted delivery, driven back to the bowler
cuts this fullish delivery from in front of off, finds extra cover
flat delivery, pushed down to long-off for one
flat, outside off, defended towards cover
flighted on the pads, whipped away to deep midwicket for one
gives him the charge, Dilshan bowls flat, he gets bat to it, and sneaks in a single to mid-off
lovely shot Tamim, beautiful, comes down the track, picks the doosra and lofts it over wide long-on, he was right to the pitch of it
defends the next delivery to extra cover
flighted delivery, almost a yorker, played down the ground for one
flat delivery, played back to the bowler
driven past extra cover for a single
looks to manufacture a cut shot, too full and too close to him, and is duly beaten
angled across him, Ashraful looks to cut and is beaten. Feet in lead there
played straight to point with an open face

swing in to the batsman, huge shout ensues, hits him on the back leg, in front of the stumps, hit over the knee roll, and height only could have saved him. Oh oh oh, in fact it was a no-ball, but his heel could have been behind the line. Late call, very tight call of no-ball
bouncer, and Ashraful is hit in the helmet, and it flies over the slips for four leg-byes
angled across him, left alone
on the pads, worked away past square leg
length ball, around off, defended back, this time the eyes were open
short ball, gets on his toes and defends
short again, rib-high, and again he is on his toes to drop it at his feet
this short one is too straight, and he pulls it to fine leg for one
presses forward to defend a back-of-a-length delivery
nice sharp bouncer, headed for his throat, plays one-handed, keeps it down
beautiful short delivery, kicks up from a back of a length, lobs off the shoulder of the bat, Samaraweera makes an attempt from slip, but manages to get just a hand to it. Can't hold onto it
angled across him, played with an open face for one
steered to third man again
defended off the front foot
slight seam movement away from him and he is beaten all ends up as he looks to drive
this time he ends up swinging outside its line, beaten twice in a row
shoulders arms outside off this time
nicely driven past extra cover, superb shot, gets to his fifty, he is some player

and he is gone, immediately after having played that beautiful shot, and Dilshan has got the big wicket to go with his crazy fifty! Nicely flighted drew him out, enough turn to beat his attempt at an inside-out drive, and Sanga makes no mistake as his foot is dragged over the line
defends the first ball he faces to the off side
goes back in the crease to push it wide of point
flighted around off, defended
big turn, from off to down the leg side, called a wide
beautifully bowled, almost gets his man, Ashraful is lured into the cover-drive, there is a gaping gap between bat and pad. Although he makes contact this time, it will encourage Dilly
back of a length, around off, pushed back to the bowler
into the pads, worked away to fine leg for one
on to the front foot to push this to cover
driven on the up, gets a single to sweeper-cover
driven on the up again, towards extra cover
bouncer, headed for the chest, Shakib bends to keep it from hitting him
played with the spin, straight to short fine leg
nothing shot, neither goes for the six nor fir the single down the ground, just a chip towards long-on, doesn't go the distance luckily for him
flat delivery, defended back

what a bizarre way to end a bizarre innings, but then again you come to expect it with Ashraful! Reverse-sweep, seriously? After not playing an intentful shot for two hours, he goes for a lame reverse sweep, and is beaten and is caught so plumb, Dilshan doesn't even appeal, and then perhaps the thought comes that match referees are not pleasant people to visit and he makes a formal appeal

and almost a run-out, Shakib is caught napping here, he has placed this between square leg and short fine, and Shakib doesn't respond. Poor Mushfiq makes two-thirds the journey and back, and the throw is yet to arrive
played with the spin, but straight to short fine
another poor call from Shakib, this time he hits to cover and runs, and Dilshan misses the direct hit that would have claimed Shakib
pitched up outside off, leaves it alone
hit hard, one bounce to cover
back of a length, stays back to defend
full, outside off, driven on the bounce to cover
nice square cut, between cover-point and backward point, gets two to third man, Mathews's dive saves the other two
full delivery, drives with an open face, can't beat backward point
inside edge as he plays away from his body, gets a single to midwicket

this time Rahim tries to run his captain out, calls him for a non-existent second, sends him back, the throw from deep square is wide, Sanga flicks the ball at the stumps, and that much time is enough for him to get in by a split frame. Very tight
defended towards cover
driven to long-off for one
punched wide of long-on, minor miracle that they both agreed on the call to take the second
seams in towards Shakib, who makes the adjustment and defends this back-of-a-length delivery
looks for a short one into the ribs, ends up bowling down the leg side
back of a length, stays back to defend
bouncer, looks to pull, sees it is wide off, pulls out of the shot - called wide for height
this time he pulls from wide outside off, almost takes Welegedara with it, and gets four down the ground
almost a slog from outside off, mis-hit towards midwicket for one
angled across him, defended to cover
on the pads, gets a single to fine leg

Dilly is having a ball here! nicely tossed up on the pads, dipping, sucking him out of the crease, and then it turns down the leg side, and Sanga completes the stumping. Billy Bowden doesn't even need the TV umpire. Dilly dancing all over the place
and almost another, offbreak headed for the middle stump, and it stays awfully low, somehow he manages to get his bat down
wide down the leg side
flighted outside off, defended
turning into the pads, helped along to midwicket for one
cut away, a diving backward-point gets a hand to it, but a wide throw from third man gives away an overthrow
turning in towards middle and off, defended
angled in, turning away, watchfully played
cut away to deep point for one
flighted around off, turning in, defended back to the bowler
cut away, gets a single to third man
opens up the stance before sweeping, bat comes from high, to keep it down, gets two to deep midwicket
tossed up around off, pushed to extra cover
turning in, worked around the corner for one
works it fine, fine of short fine leg, gets two
presses well forward to defend
full delivery, pushed to extra cover
cut away, gets a single to sweeper-cover
nicely tossed up outside off, defended to cover
that swat-sweep again, goes against the turn but that bat comes form well high and hence keeps it along the ground
nicely cut away, wide of third man for two
another single to third man
another nothing shot costs Bangladesh a wicket, goes back, plays with an angled bat, across the line, and ends up hitting outside the line of a slow offbreak. The off bail is tickled over
defends an offbreak outside off
pushes forward and outside off, and pads this away, a polite enquiry from  Mahela at slip. Too far outside off
full ball, driven down to long-on for one
defended outside off, one bounce to silly point
into the pads, worked away to midwicket
turning in, worked away to short fine leg
wide down the leg side
punched away off the back foot, gets a single to sweeper cover
back of a length, around off, defended
sharp inwards movement, drops and runs, gets a single
defends towards point
another defensive shot with an open face
tries the short one, wide down the leg side
bouncer again, beats his pull shot
defended off the back foot
offbreak, helped away to fine leg for one
cuts this to third man for one
flat delivery, inside edge towards short fine leg, wants a single but is sent back rightly
premeditated sweep, misses, big shout, but he is hit outside the line of off
defended towards silly point
doosra, played with an open face towards point
drops towards cover and takes a single
steered to third man for one
looks to run this down to third man, ends up playing it to point
bouncer, and he ducks under it
played with an open face, gets a single past point
plays with open face again, can't get it past point this time
stays low as he looks to cut, beaten
comes down the track, chips but it hardly goes anywhere, two bounces to mid-off
flighted on middle and leg, played to midwicket
doosra, rocks on the back foot and cuts it in front of square, gets four
too short again, punched away this time for four
late-cuts this time, gets a single past short third man
length ball outside off, left alone
slower ball, nearly yokrer, ends up being a low full toss, he keeps it out
short ball, down the leg side
full toss, down the leg side, Sanga does well to get a hand to it while diving to his left
short ball, this time he somehow manages to get his head out of the way
another short ball, his eyes are off it, and he somehow manages to stay inside the line, Sanga appeals but it has taken the sleeve on the way
angled into the pads, gets a leg-bye
and gets a wicket right away, another gift really, charging at him and edging a shortish delivery through to Sangakkara. Anyway the innings was not going anywhere, so something had to be done
left alone outside off
beaten outside off this time, just short of a length, angling away
fuller, and he hangs his fishing rod there, beaten again
hangs his bat inside the line of the ball - not deliberately I am sure
beauty to finish the wicket-maiden, pitching middle and off and angling away, beating the outside edge again
full and fast, outside off, played back to the bowler
slower full ball that dips suddenly, gets the toe end of the bat
bouncer, he ducks under it
short one, aiming at the ribs, but it slides slightly down the leg side
toecrusher, good old toecrusher, Naeem can limp back to the pavilion, reverse swing, chasing that toe like a dog. Beautiful bowling
length ball outside off, Shafiul gets a single to third man
yorker outside off, beaten
backs away and defends this shortish delivery back to the bowler
and he pierces them, along the ground too
played away from the body, with an open face, and it somehow travels between third man and deep point
that's a nice tailender's shot, backs away, gives it the whammy, and the edge flies over slips
better shot, backs away again, gets a length ball and smashes it back down the ground, that's how tailenders should bat
big hoick this time, he misses the ball, the ball misses the leg stump
how did that miss the leg stump? another yorker, he has no clue about it, but it misses the stumps
how are they missing the stumps? Mash makes sure his feet are out of harm's way, the ball bounces on the popping crease and misses the leg stump again
another yorker outside leg, gets his bat to it and comes back for two by the time long-on comes around
slower ball this time, headed for the prone stumps before Mash gets his bat down
slower ball, outside off, the mis-hit lobs towards long-on
another yorker misses the stumps, the off stick this time
nine down there, Mash heaves at one too many, making room, and gets a thick edge to a back-of-a-length delivery to the keeper
driven into the off side, one bounce to Dilshan at cover
short ball, pulls and misses, half a shout but nothing there
into the ribs, plays it one-handed
edged away, but falls short of Samaraweera at slip
inside edge onto the pad, another wicket-maiden for Welegedara
hits his pad with a yorker, but down the leg side
finally it's all over, finally Malinga bowls one yorker on the middle-stump line, and Sri Lanka have registered a bonus point against Tamim and friends
